Dear Ms. Carlton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Adoptive family evaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12605
Section • (1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
Description written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving
a family for adoption.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency has had significant delays with their family
assessments.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Reporting Source was interviewed via Microsoft Teams on
2/15/2024. He reported the same information that was received in
the complaint. He reported he was forwarded information from a
family that had been working with a private agency, Child Safe
regarding their interest in adopting a child from the Michigan
Adoption Resource Exchange (MARE). He said the family voiced
significant concerns about their experience working with the
agency. He said he made the complaint because it relates to
standard of promptness concerns and family assessments. He
reported the family started their adoption process late summer of
2021 with an adoption application and their home assessment
was approved in April 2022. The reporting source provided the
Potential Adoptive Family detail timeline of dates when the
adoption process began with the agency and family and when it
ended. The timeline of dates will be discussed later in this report.
The reporting source did not have any additional information.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via telephone on
2/15/2024. She reported the supervisor over the agency adoption
department at that time is no longer employed with the agency.
The CA reported the current supervisor (Adoption Worker 1)
shared with her the Potential Adoptive Family saw Youth A’s
profile on MARE in July 2021 and decided to fill out an application.
The CA reported she believes the home study was completed in
March of 2022 and the delay was due to an environmental
inspection that the agency was waiting on. The CA said the
agency received the environmental report from the county on
3/9/2022. The CA reported as soon as the agency home study
2

was almost completed, the agency Adoption Worker 1 reached
out to Youth A’s adoption worker (Adoption Worker 2) in another
county to let her know that their agency (Child Safe) had a family
who was interested in the adoption of Youth A and the family
home study was almost completed. The CA reported according to
her knowledge, Adoption Worker 2 responded back stating Youth
A had already been matched with a family and his current
matched family and Youth A were visiting with one another. The
CA said her agency Adoption Worker 1 responded by informing
Adoption Worker 2 their agency (Child Safe) family was very
interested with the adoption process if the current family identified
did not work out. It is noted Youth A was adopted by the family
who was identified from another county.
Adoption Worker 1 (ADW 1) was interviewed via email on
3/8/2024. She reported she received the case in August 2021
when the previous worker went on maternity leave. She said the
Potential Adoptive Family completed the adoption application on
7/28/2021 and the home study was completed on 4/14/2022.
ADW 1 reported she mailed the home study to the family but could
not remember the date.
ADW 1 reported the previous worker completed an outdated
version of the fingerprint forms, so the Potential Adoptive Family
had to re-do their fingerprints. ADW 1 reported the Potential
Adoptive Family was not prompt in turning in their documentation.
ADW 1 reported as of October 2021 the family financial
documentation was still needed as well as clearance information
for an adult son. She said the clearance information on the adult
son was received to their agency in January 2022.
ADW 1 reported when she completed the Potential Adoptive
Family interview, the family was only interested in specific
questions surrounding Youth A. ADW 1 reported she told the
family they should not ask questions specific to Youth A or get
attached to one child because things may not work out and other
families may be interested in that same child as well as may be a
match for the child in question.
ADW 1 reported she was informed by the Potential Adoptive
Family that they had inquired on the MARE website about Youth
A. The family’s foster care navigator told the family they should
inquire on the MARE website even though they did not have a
complete home study. ADW 1 reported this was not typical
procedure and that a family should not inquire on a child without
having an approved home study.
3

ADOPTION WORKER 2 (ADW 2) was interviewed via telephone
on 3/15/2024. She reported she was Youth A’s assigned adoption
worker for a year and a half from Allegan County where his case
resides. She reported the adoptive family inquired through MARE
in January 2022. A family assessment was shared with Youth A’s
adoption worker and Youth A’s child adoption assessment was
shared with the family. The ADW 2 reported a full disclosure
meeting took place with the adoptive family and Youth A on
2/9/2022. She reported afterwards the adoptive family considered
all information and decided to move forward getting to know Youth
A and pursuing adoption. She reported the first meeting was held
by way of Zoom on 3/22/2022 and the first in person overnight
stay occurred on 4/29/2022. ADW 2 reported overnights and
weekend visits occurred every month thereafter. She reported the
adoptive placement in the home took place on January 20, 2023.
The ADW 2 reported at no time was another family sought out as
she works with one family at a time unless the family working with
the youth expresses interest in not moving forward with the intent
to adopt. She reported Youth A had two failed adoption attempts
prior and this adoptive family was interested in helping Youth A
with his behavior issues and diagnoses.
The Potential Adoptive Family was interviewed on 3/18/2024.
They reported a timeline of Child Safe for process of their adoptive
home study. A summary is provided and is as follows:
• March 2021 – made a telephone call to MARE.
• April 2021 – July 2021 – Attended meeting/training at a
private agency about pursing adoption.
• July 28, 2021 – signed adoption application.
• August 2021 – October 31, 2021 – Child Safe informed the
family that another set of fingerprints was needed.
• November 2021 – December 2021 -Home study was not
completed.
• March 2022 – Begin to inquire from the agency if their
home study was written.
• April 1, 2022 – Home study was submitted.
• April 14,2022 – Home study approved.
• April 29, 2022 – Discovered the home study was approved
two weeks prior but was not informed until the family
inquired about it.
• August 2022 – Update from Child Safe informing the family
she will remind Youth A’s ADW 2, that her family was still
interested in adoption placement for Youth A.
4

• September 2022 – Never received a copy of the home
study from Child Safe, five months later.
• November 2022 – was informed by Child Safe worker the
Potential Adoptive Family should consider fostering other
children prior to the adoption process.
• December 2022 February 2023 – Volunteering at other
private agencies to be involved with children by wrapping
Christmas gifts and attending more training.
• February 2023 – Child Safe adoption worker 1 reached out
to the family about other children on MARE.
• May 2023 – Attended last volunteer time at private agency.
• September 2023 – attended their last Heart Gallery 3rd year
hoping someone would provide hope to help her family
adopt a youth.
The Potential Adoptive Family reported they felt the process was
very long and she feels it was a disservice to her and her family.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
• Youth A’s last Foster Care Permanent Ward Service Plan
dated 9/30/2022 – 12/22/2022 detailing his placements
history and behaviors while in placements.
• Finalize Adoption approval dated 9/18/2023.
• Applicant Application dated 7/28/2021.
• Initial Foster/Adoption Evaluation dated 4/14/2022.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance due to not completing the
home evaluation within 90 days of the agency receiving the signed
application from the Potential Adoptive Family. The application
was received on 7/28/2021 and the home study was completed on
4/14/2022.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
